HEADER.Name: BTUC25: Main Example
HEADER.PageFooterScripts: <script src="https://cdn.datatables.net/2.3.4/js/dataTables.js"></script>|13||10|<script>|13||10| /* ----------------------------|13||10| Description: Passed a data table ID and a (1-based) column index, returns a promise|13||10| that resolves to a JSON object for the column. Allows dashboards to utilize queries|13||10| that return JSON objects in multiple columns.|13||10| ---------------------------- */|13||10| function loadJsonFromDTCol(DataTableID, colIndex) {|13||10| return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {|13||10| // Use jQuery to select the table cell at the specified index|13||10| const col = $(".Table" + DataTableID + " td:nth-child(" + colIndex + ")");|13||10| // Check if the table element exists and has content|13||10| if (col) {|13||10| if (col.length > 0) {|13||10| // The replace regex was in the original, but probably not needed here?|13||10| const colData = col[0].innerHTML|13||10| .replace(/(?:\r\n|\r|\n)/g, "")|13||10| .replace(/\t/g, "")|13||10| .replaceAll(/[ ]{2,}/g, " ");|13||10| if (colData.length > 0) {|13||10| try {|13||10| resolve(JSON.parse(colData));|13||10| } catch (error) {|13||10| reject(|13||10| new Error(|13||10| `Failed to parse JSON from column data: ${error.message}`|13||10| )|13||10| );|13||10| }|13||10| } else {|13||10| reject(|13||10| new Error(|13||10| `Column data for Table${DataTableID}, index ${colIndex} is empty`|13||10| )|13||10| );|13||10| }|13||10| } else {|13||10| reject(|13||10| new Error(|13||10| `Unable to locate DOM element Table${DataTableID}; check ID`|13||10| )|13||10| );|13||10| }|13||10| }|13||10| });|13||10| }|13||10||13||10| /* Change chart type when the radio button is checked */|13||10| function handleRadioChange(e) {|13||10| setChartType(e.value);|13||10| }|13||10||13||10| function setChartType(newtype) {|13||10| // Use the second chart; could also use FusionCharts(fusionChartId) if id is known|13||10| const testchart = Object.values(FusionCharts.items)[1];|13||10| //const testchart = FusionCharts(fusionChartId);|13||10| testchart.chartType(newtype);|13||10| }|13||10||13||10| // Global variable. Datatable component ID; update index to match order on Dashboard|13||10| const compID = $('div[class^="Component"]')[4].id;|13||10||13||10| $(document).ready(function () {|13||10| // Load column 3 data|13||10| loadJsonFromDTCol(compID, 3)|13||10| .then(function (data) {|13||10| // Initialize DataTable with the loaded data|13||10| const table = $('#orderTable').DataTable({|13||10| paging: true,|13||10| data: data,|13||10| columns: [|13||10| { data: 'BranchName' },|13||10| { data: 'OrderID' },|13||10| { data: 'OrderNumber' },|13||10| { data: 'DateTimeCreated' },|13||10| // Format TotalSellPrice as currency|13||10| { data: 'TotalSellPrice', render: $.fn.dataTable.render.number(',', '.', 2, '$') },|13||10| { data: 'OrderStatus' }|13||10| ]|13||10| });|13||10| // Make each row clickable with a pointer cursor|13||10| $('#orderTable tbody').css('cursor', 'pointer').on('click', 'tr', function () {|13||10| // Get the full data object for the clicked row|13||10| const rowData = table.row(this).data();|13||10| if (rowData) {|13||10| // Create our drilldown link using OrderID and BranchName|13||10| const customURL = "dislinkDrillDown209393%C3%82%C2%A0%drilldownID1%=" + rowData.OrderID + "%C3%82%C2%A0%drilldowncaption%='" + rowData.BranchName + "'%C3%82%C2%A0";|13||10| console.log(customURL);|13||10| window.location.href = customURL;|13||10| }|13||10| });|13||10| })|13||10| .catch(function (error) {|13||10| console.error(error.message);|13||10| });|13||10||13||10| });|13||10||13||10| FusionCharts.ready(function () {|13||10| // Calculate new dimensions for the charts; provide a small gap|13||10| const newWidth = (window.innerWidth - 15) / 2;|13||10| const newHeight = (window.innerHeight - 15) / 2;|13||10| // Use the JSON in column 1 to overwrite the pie chart|13||10| loadJsonFromDTCol(compID, 1)|13||10| .then(function (data) {|13||10| // Pie chart component ID|13||10| const cID = "209391";|13||10| // Chart ID is prefixed with "fc"|13||10| const chartID = "fc" + cID;|13||10| // Get the current chart object|13||10| const myChart = FusionCharts(chartID);|13||10| // Resize after render to ensure proper layout|13||10| myChart.addEventListener('rendered', function () {|13||10| $('#' + cID).css({|13||10| 'float': 'left',|13||10| 'width': newWidth + 'px',|13||10| 'height': newHeight + 'px',|13||10| });|13||10| myChart.resizeTo(newWidth, newHeight);|13||10| });|13||10| // Set the new data|13||10| myChart.setJSONData(data);|13||10| })|13||10| .catch(function (error) {|13||10| console.error(error.message);|13||10| });|13||10| // Use the JSON in column 2 to overwrite the line chart|13||10| loadJsonFromDTCol(compID, 2)|13||10| .then(function (data) {|13||10| const cID = "209392";|13||10| const chartID = "fc" + cID;|13||10| const myChart = FusionCharts(chartID);|13||10| // Resize after render to ensure proper layout|13||10| myChart.addEventListener('rendered', function () {|13||10| $('#' + cID).css({|13||10| 'float': 'right', // This aligns the second chart to the right|13||10| 'width': newWidth + 'px',|13||10| 'height': newHeight + 'px'|13||10| });|13||10| myChart.resizeTo(newWidth, newHeight);|13||10| });|13||10| myChart.setJSONData(data);|13||10||13||10| myChart.addEventListener("dataPlotClick", function (event, data) {|13||10| console.log("Data plot clicked:", data);|13||10| alert("You clicked on " + data.categoryLabel + " with a value of " + data.dataValue);|13||10| const ddLink = "dislinkDrillDown209393%C3%82%C2%A0%drilldownID1%=" + data.dataValue + "%C3%82%C2%A0%drilldowncaption%='" + data.categoryLabel + "'%C3%82%C2%A0";|13||10| console.log(ddLink);|13||10| document.location.href = ddLink;|13||10| });|13||10| })|13||10| .catch(function (error) {|13||10| console.error(error.message);|13||10| });|13||10||13||10| // Create a new chart using col 3 data|13||10| loadJsonFromDTCol(compID, 3)|13||10| .then(function (data) {|13||10| // Return an object with branch names as keys and counts as values|13||10| const branchCount = Object.fromEntries([...data.reduce((m, o) => m.set(o.BranchName, (m.get(o.BranchName) || 0) + 1), new Map()).entries()]);|13||10| // Convert to FusionCharts data format|13||10| const chartData = [];|13||10| for (const [branchName, count] of Object.entries(branchCount)) {|13||10| chartData.push({ label: branchName, value: count });|13||10| }|13||10| // Create the chart new (don't overwrite an existing one)|13||10| const newChart = new FusionCharts({|13||10| type: 'column2d',|13||10| renderAt: 'newFC',|13||10| width: newWidth,|13||10| height: newHeight,|13||10| dataFormat: 'json',|13||10| dataSource: {|13||10| chart: {|13||10| caption: 'Orders by Branch',|13||10| subCaption: '',|13||10| xAxisName: 'Branch',|13||10| yAxisName: 'Number of Orders',|13||10| theme: 'fusion',|13||10| bgColor: 'FFFFFF',|13||10| bgAlpha: '100'|13||10| },|13||10| data: chartData|13||10| }|13||10| });|13||10| newChart.render();|13||10||13||10| })|13||10| .catch(function (error) {|13||10| console.error(error.message);|13||10| });|13||10| // Resize the data table container so that all the components fill the screen|13||10| $("#dtGrid").css({ "width": newWidth + "px", "height": newHeight + "px" });|13||10| });|13||10|</script>
HEADER.Notes: Displays three charts and one datatable to illustrate multiple concepts: 1.) A hidden DataTable component returns three columns of disparate JSON data. The first two columns are FusionChart objects and the third is an array of objects representing the last 53 sales (odd number chosen for paging) 2.) The first two charts (PieChart_Overwrite and LineChart_Overwrite) are manually added as components on the dashboard. The SQL for each selects one row of dummy data. Javascript manipulates these existing objects. 3.) Javascript in the Header and Footer tab overwrites the first two charts using data from columns 1 and 2 of the hiddden datatable a.) The FusionCharts class allows direct access to the chart object and data. Charts are resized to fit the current window b.) The line chart has drilldowns enabled for data points. Click a datapoint to open the TEST SmartView, passing selected data c.) The line chart also has a row of radio buttons above it allowing the chart type to be changed dynamically d.) The original chart objects use XML; the JavaScript changes the data to JSON e.) The line chart has a (hideous) gradient background defined in the SQL for column 3; the pie chart background is similarly set to white 4.) A datatable (datatables.net) is created from column 3 JSON. The table is initially defined in the "SecondRow" veritical space and bound with JavaScript a.) All rows are clickable (tr onClick event) and point to the TEST drilldown b.) The Sell Price column is formatted as currency 5.) Using the same datatable data (column 3), a new FusionChart is created in the bottom right quadrant. Apart from a <div> element in the SecondRow vertiical line component, this chart did not exist on the dashboard component. This illustrates creating charts new instead of overwriting existing. 6.) Finally, a hidden TextLine component points to the TEST SmartView as a drilldown. No drilldown values are hard coded to allow dynamic values to be passed.

COMPONENT_1.ExtraHTML: 2D| 3D | Line
COMPONENT_1.Name: ChartTypeRadios

COMPONENT_4.ExtraHTML: BranchOrder IDOrder NumberDate CreatedSell PriceOrder Status
COMPONENT_4.ExtraStyle: width: unset; width: initial; height: unset; height: initial;
COMPONENT_4.Name: SecondRow

COMPONENT_5.Name: JSONData
COMPONENT_5.SQL1: SELECT J1.PieChart, J2.LineChart, J3.DataTable|13||10|FROM (|13||10| SELECT -- Without FOR JSON PATH, this would return two JSON cols|13||10| JSON_QUERY(C.ChartJSON) AS [chart]|13||10| , JSON_QUERY(D.dataJSON) AS [data]|13||10| FROM|13||10| ( -- Chart config here|13||10| SELECT|13||10| 'Last Sales Line by Sales Rep' AS [caption]|13||10| , 'Simple 3D Pie Chart Example' AS [subCaption]|13||10| , 'fusion' AS [theme]|13||10| , '20' AS [slicingDistance]|13||10| , '1' AS [showTooltip]|13||10| , '1' AS [showLegend]|13||10| , '1' AS [showLegendBorder]|13||10| , '1' AS [showPercentValues]|13||10| , '1' AS [enableSmartLabels]|13||10| , '1' AS [isSmartLineSlanted]|13||10| , '1' AS [useDataPlotColorForLabels]|13||10| , '0' AS [showPlotBorder]|13||10| , '0' AS [decimals]|13||10| , 'FFFFFF' AS [bgColor]|13||10| , '20' AS [bgAlpha]|13||10| FOR JSON PATH, WITHOUT_ARRAY_WRAPPER|13||10| ) AS C(ChartJSON) CROSS JOIN|13||10| ( -- Sales info subquery in another column|13||10| SELECT TOP(1) WITH TIES|13||10| sr.Name AS [label]|13||10| , sa.TotalSales AS [value]|13||10| FROM SalesAnalysis3 sa WITH(NOLOCK)|13||10| INNER JOIN SalesRep sr WITH(NOLOCK) ON sr.SalesRepID = sa.SalesRepID|13||10| WHERE sr.Deleted = 0|13||10| AND sa.TotalSales <> 0|13||10| AND sa.DocumentType = 'Invoice'|13||10| ORDER BY ROW_NUMBER() OVER(PARTITION BY sa.SalesRepID ORDER BY sa.DocumentDate DESC)|13||10| FOR JSON PATH|13||10| ) AS D(dataJSON)|13||10| FOR JSON PATH, WITHOUT_ARRAY_WRAPPER|13||10|) AS J1(PieChart),|13||10| (|13||10| SELECT -- Without FOR JSON PATH, this would return two JSON cols|13||10| JSON_QUERY(C.ChartJSON) AS [chart]|13||10| , JSON_QUERY(D.dataJSON) AS [data]|13||10| FROM|13||10| ( -- Chart config here|13||10| SELECT|13||10| 'Random Monthly Data' AS [caption]|13||10| , 'Click a label to drilldown. Change chart type by clicking radio button above' AS [subCaption]|13||10| , 'fusion' AS [theme]|13||10| , '1' AS [showTooltip]|13||10| , '1' AS [showLegend]|13||10| , '1' AS [showLegendBorder]|13||10| , 'Month' AS [xAxisName]|13||10| , 'Revenue (in Millions)' AS [yAxisName]|13||10| , '$' AS [numberPrefix]|13||10| , '1' AS [useDataPlotColorForLabels]|13||10| , '0' AS [showPlotBorder]|13||10| , '0' AS [decimals]|13||10| , '3190d6,FFFFFF' AS [bgColor]|13||10| , '60,40' AS [bgRatio]|13||10| , '90' AS [bgAngle]|13||10| , '60,70' AS [bgAlpha]|13||10| FOR JSON PATH, WITHOUT_ARRAY_WRAPPER|13||10| ) AS C(ChartJSON) CROSS JOIN|13||10| ( -- Generate random data for 12 months|13||10| SELECT|13||10| FORMAT(DATEFROMPARTS(1900, v.number, 1), 'MMM', 'en-US') AS [label]|13||10| , CAST(ABS(CHECKSUM(NEWID())) % 100 AS INT) AS [value]|13||10| FROM master..spt_values v|13||10| WHERE v.type='p'|13||10| AND v.number BETWEEN 1 AND 12|13||10| FOR JSON PATH|13||10| ) AS D(dataJSON)|13||10| FOR JSON PATH, WITHOUT_ARRAY_WRAPPER|13||10|) AS J2(LineChart),|13||10| (|13||10| SELECT TOP 53|13||10| b.Name AS BranchName|13||10| , oh.OrderID|13||10| , oh.OrderNumber|13||10| , CONVERT(VARCHAR(10), oh.DateTimeCreated, 101) AS [DateTimeCreated]|13||10| , oh.TotalSellPrice|13||10| , os.Name [OrderStatus]|13||10| FROM OrderHeader oh WITH(NOLOCK)|13||10| INNER JOIN OrderStatus os WITH(NOLOCK) ON os.OrderStatusID = oh.OrderStatus|13||10| INNER JOIN Branch b WITH(NOLOCK) ON b.BranchID = oh.BranchID|13||10| WHERE oh.Deleted = 0|13||10| ORDER BY oh.DateTimeCreated DESC|13||10| FOR JSON PATH|13||10|) AS J3(DataTable)

HEADER.SQLStatement: DECLARE @dd1 INT = %drilldownID1%, @dd2 INT = %drilldownID2%, @dd3 VARCHAR(255) = %drilldowncaption%, @dd4 VARCHAR(255) = %drilldownString%|13||10||13||10|SELECT |13||10| @dd1 = ISNULL(@dd1 , -1)|13||10| , @dd2 = ISNULL(@dd2, -2)|13||10| , @dd3 = ISNULL(@dd3, '')|13||10| , @dd4 = ISNULL(@dd4, '')|13||10||13||10|SELECT |13||10| @dd1 AS [DrillDownID1]|13||10|, @dd2 AS [DrilldownID2]|13||10|, @dd3 AS [Drilldowncaption]|13||10|, @dd4 AS [DrilldownTestString]
HEADER.Name: TEST
HEADER.Notes: Some notes here New line New line 2

The first two charts (PieChart_Overwrite and LineChart_Overwrite) are manually added as components on the dashboard. The SQL for each selects one row of dummy data. Javascript manipulates these existing objects.|13||10|3.) Javascript in the Header and Footer tab overwrites the first two charts using data from columns 1 and 2 of the hiddden datatable|13||10| a.) The FusionCharts class allows direct access to the chart object and data. Charts are resized to fit the current window|13||10| b.) The line chart has drilldowns enabled for data points. The line chart has a (hideous) gradient background defined in the SQL for column 3; the pie chart background is similarly set to white|13||10|4.)
